tinctly explained Weyrother's plan of a flank- ing movement. 
Prince Andrew began to reply and to state his own plan, which might have been as good as Weyrother's, but for the disadvantage that Weyrother's had already been approved. As soon as Prince Andrew began to demonstrate the defects of the latter and the merits of his own plan, Prince Dolgoriikov ceased to listen to him and gazed absent-mindedly not at the map, but at Prince Andrew's face.
